Alignment Utilities

Vertical-align children

Try to avoid using for essential, non-decorative things Aligns children of selected element using flexbox.

@extend %valignChildren;
@extend %valignChildren--bottom;

Animation

Subtle bounce-in

Subtle bounce effect using keyframes, provided via simple mixin original keyframes generated with Bounce.js

@include animate--bounce-in-subtle($time: 750ms);

Infinite spin

Infinite 2d rotation; 0-360deg.

@include animate--spin($time: 0.8s);

Background Utilities

Background clip mixin

Sets background-clip property

@include background-clip($value: padding);
@include background-clip('border');

Image fill placeholder

Sets background properties that center background image, set size to 'cover', and overflow hidden.

[ie. avatars][avatar]

@extend %imgFill;

Media Query Breakpoints

Mobile first mixin

This breakpoint mixin uses a mobile first strategy, meaning the medium breakpoint, for example, applies to medium screens and larger.

    @include atMediaUp(medium) {
        body::after {
            content: "medium screens and larger can see me";
        }
    }
Breakpoint name Description
atMediaUp(small) Small sreens and up
atMediaUp(medium) Landscape on most phones and up; portrait on some phablets
atMediaUp(large) Landscape on phabelts and up; portrait on most tablets or old desktops
atMediaUp(huge) Modern desktop viewports and up or ridiculous huge tablets

Breaking for smaller sizes and under

In the event you need to target a specific screen size and under, use the atMediaDown mixin.

    @include atMediaDown(medium) {
        body::after {
            content: "medium screens and smaller can see me";
        }
    }
Breakpoint name Description
atMediaDown(small) Small screens and under; portrait on most mobile devices
atMediaDown(medium) Landscape on most phones and under; portrait on some phablets
atMediaDown(large) Landscape on phabelts and under; portrait on most tablets or old desktops
atMediaDown(huge) Huge screens and under

Targeting a specific breakpoint

It will be rare that we target a specific breakpoint, but the atMediaOnly mixin will do this.

    @include atMediaOnly(medium) {
        body::after {
            content: "only medium screens will see this";
        }
    }
Breakpoint name Description
atMediaOnly(small) Small screens only
atMediaOnly(medium) Landscape on most phones only
atMediaOnly(large) Landscape on phabelts only
atMediaOnly(huge) Huge screens only

Button utilities

Button personality placeholder

Disables user-select, sets cursor, and resets text-decoration.

@extend %buttonPersonality;

data uri images

Sassquatch image dependencies are stored as data uris in a Sass map.

map-get($data-img-map, "orgBadge") // raw data uri

// OR

.elWithImgBackground {
    @extend %backgroundImg--orgBadge; // sets background-image property
}
Img Name Description
orgBadge Organizer badge
launcher Form launcher input icon

Display utils

Pseudo-element display mixin

Sets display property for psuedo-elements

@include pseudoDisplay($value: block);

Float utils

Clearfix placeholder

Clears floated children.

@extend %clearfix;

Shadow utilities

Shadow placeholder

Applies standard box-shadow

@extend %shadow;

Shapes

Circle mixin

Makes selected element a circle with border-radius

@mixin circle($color: black, $size: 12px)

Text utils

Link color

Forces an element to use link-like styling.

@extend %link;

Text protection shim

Adds a pseudo-element gradient

@mixin textProtectionScrim($placement: 'top'); // 'bottom' will place gradent on bottom of el
